Can I pick your two brains real fast.  Wanting to do a crowd-sourced, lo-fi, "What's been Plowed" map here in Bmore.  I'm building it on Sat.  Here's the start » http://whatsbeenplowed.com/map  People can login with FB/Twitter then simply draw polyline's (passable roads) on the red map (impassable roads).  Thoughts?

@llimllib Had similar thoughts for the pothole problem but thought of using seismographic info.  Looks like someone else is running with the same idea » http://boston.cbslocal.com/2011/02/09/boston-targets-potholes-with-phone-app-patcher/
And they have nifty tools for messaging the responsible parties for the area your issue is in (including electeds)

Yeah, it's just a simple Sinatra app that grabs the oauth info we need and then we go grab the connections and the edges between them.

yeah, the really fun thing about this project is that we have oauth keys now, so unless folks revoke permission we can graph this data as it evolves over time and actually reflect social changes happening in the city
